newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares end down on weak sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares end down on weak sentiment.

text.p: Shanghai B Shares ended down on Wednesday on weak market sentiment despite domestic support, brokers on Wednesday said.
The index shed 0.161 points or 0.31 percent to 51.331 points, on volume of 10.5 million shares worth $3.9 million. Of 41 B shares, 34 traded with 14 down, 10 flat and 10 up.
Brokers said that overseas selling in many stocks which posted poor interim results was still depressing market sentiment.
"Investors have no interest in buying stocks which posted disappointing results at current levels," one broker said.
"Technical charts show signs of breaking down, but the market will find support at 50 points," a second broker said.
Shanghai Phoenix was the biggest loser, falling $0.008 or 6.25 percent to $0.120 on volume of 187,100 shares.
Heilongjiang Electric Power traded the most on institutional buying, gaining $0.006 or 1.59 percent to $0.382 on volume of 1.6 million shares.
Shanghai A share index closed up on an inflow of funds from the Shenzhen stock market, but selling pressure around 850 points was heavy, brokers said.
